results.content:
The audio quality in the first lessons was very bad with disturbing background noise. I couldn't believe that Udemy allowed publishing videos with bad audio quality. Later author upgraded the audio quality, but still, it was very disappointing. 

Probably the author is a good developer but not a good tutor. He can't properly explain the topics and concepts. The whole course he copies and pastes code from repo which he copied from eShopOnContainers and tries to explain it with his limited vocabulary.  

His strong accent is hard to understand. To solve this problem he could've added proper subtitles as many students requested, but he didn't. He also makes a lot of elementary-level grammar mistakes which are confusing sometimes. His speech is too slow. I had to use 1.5 or 1.75 speed. 

If you are new to microservices I recommend studying the eShopOnContainers repository on GitHub and guide books from that repo. The .NET microservices Path courses on Pluralsight were done much more professionally in terms of tutoring quality.
I hope the author will consider all the above and improve the quality of his courses.

response.content: Thanks for your feedback. Sorry for inconvenience and yes I took all your concerns as a development point of myself.  I am also aware of this problems and working on that issues but as you can know that will requires some time.

results.content: The instructor is very knowledgeable, and the course is very easy to follow. But I wish the instructor cared more about his time management. As much as I enjoyed the course I must say it could have (and should have) been 4 times shorter. First the instructor shows a powerpoint that explains the subject; then he shows examples of similar classes from other services we developed before; then he explains everything again as he writes the code; and finally he makes a recap of everything he did just in case we nodded off first 4 times he explained it. And then we move on to the next service where he instead of copy-pasting the same class he explains it again as if that was a brand new thing...

results.content: This is the first course on ASP.NET Core Microservices available on Udemy with complete coverage on topics starting from Docker, MongoDB, Reddis, RabbitMQ for event driven architecture, Clean architecture, Ocelet API gateway and many more. I saw some comments about Author's English but I did not find any issue with that, If you carefully listen Author then, you will surely understand the concept. This course has all to start designing your own Microservices. I would like to see this course being updated for more Security features like OAuth 2.0, Inter service communication and other security aspect. But overall great course from Mr. Mehmet and will definitely recommend it.

Keep up the great work, Mehmet!

Thanks for the outstanding course.
